contentrichtext.text: '''Redechius''' ({{lang-cy|Rhydderch mab Arthmael}}{{Citation needed|date=January 2009}}) was a legendary king of the [[Britons (historic)|Britons]] according to [[Geoffrey of Monmouth]]'s ''[[Historia Regum Britanniae|History of the Kings of Britain]]'' (1136). He was preceded by [[Redon (king)|Redon]] and succeeded by [[Sawyl Penuchel|Samuil Penissel]].<ref>[[wikisource:History of the Kings of Britain/Book 3#19|''History of the Kings of Britain'' 3.19]] at Wikisource. Lewis Thorpe's translation for Penguin Classics (p. 105) gives two kings following him, Samuil followed by Penessil.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-reg | leg }} {{s-bef | before = [[Redon of Britain|Redon]] }} {{s-ttl | title = [[List of legendary kings of Britain|King of Britain]] }} {{s-aft | after = [[Sawyl Penuchel|Samuil Penissel]] }} {{s-end}} <!-- NB not a stub - this is absolutely ALL there is to say about Geoffrey's one-line fictitious character (like so many of the others in this cat.!) --> [[Category:British traditional history]]
